summary: This is a brief email chain from July 7, 2019, between U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman and other prosecutors regarding the preparation of a follow-up search warrant in the Jeffrey Epstein case. Berman notes the search has provided important corroborating evidence and requests comments on draft press remarks.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Author of the main email, thanking his team for working late on a follow-up warrant, noting the search provided corroborating evidence, and requesting comments on draft press remarks.

events.title: Preparation of Follow-up Search Warrant
events.description: The prosecution team worked late into the night and early morning preparing a follow-up search warrant in the Jeffrey Epstein investigation.

events.title: Search Provides Corroborating Evidence
events.description: U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman states that a search conducted in the Epstein investigation has already provided important corroborating evidence.

keyFacts: The email is dated July 7, 2019, shortly before Jeffrey Epstein's arrest on July 6, 2019.
The prosecution team worked late preparing a follow-up search warrant, indicating active, urgent investigative steps.
A search had already been conducted and provided 'important corroborating evidence' in the case.
Geoffrey Berman was preparing press remarks, suggesting imminent public announcements or actions related to the case.
